data.title: A fine way to spend a couple of hours.
data.text: We went here while our kids were at an orchestra festival...it was a fine way to spend some time.  Not a GREAT museum...but it was ok. Some things were rather silly...like the G I Joe collection and the gold plated BB gun.  Don't bother with the creepy basement...it was a touch too weird.  Gift shop had nice local crafts...higly reccomend. The Customs House itself was the highlight of the tour.

data.title: Awesome local museum
data.text: While visiting my hometown of Clarksville, my son was able to spend some time at this museum and it was wonderful.  He thoroughly enjoyed all of the exhibits and was elated to learn that his grandma attended high school with Wilma Rudolph (who is on display) many years ago.  My son is already planning for us to return to the museum again during our next visit to Clarksville.

data.title: Fun For A Few Hours
data.text: We went and saw the Norman Rockwell exhibit.  It was wonderful - very nostalgic.  The museum is light and airy.  The staff are very friendly.  The train exhibit is awesome.  We enjoyed our two hours there.

data.title: Kids loved it
data.text: We walked along the McGregor trail along the Cumberland and hopped off at Commerce Street. I wasn't sure if the kids would like the museum, but the kids area in the bottom floor was fantastic! There were some great hands-on, scientific experiments, a kids "grocery store", and tons of other educational toys. I played with Lincoln Logs for the first time in 30 years. The bubble cave was super fun too!

data.title: Bubble Cave!
data.text: I took my grandkids for a visit.  The bubble cave was a BIG hit!  Oh, and the wonderful woman at the information desk with the shark cookie jar!  My boys wanted to stay with her!  The basement is the best part when when you have small children.  Great spot for a hot our rainy day.

data.title: Nice Stop
data.text: The oustside of the building was my favorite - reminded me of the Haunted Mansion at Disney World. Many really nice displays inside including a post office and lots of historical information about the area. Didn't know Wilma Rudolf was from this town. Nice area for children like a bubble room and other hands on stuff. Friendly staff and nice tiny gift shop.

data.title: Decent Museum
data.text: The local museum is a nice place but I must say that I have always been left wanting when I have visited the place.  Clarksville being the 5th largest city in the state you would kind of expect it to be a little bigger.  But they do always do a nice job with their exhibits.

data.title: Helpful staff
data.text:
My elderly mother has walking issues and needed a wheelchair. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They got us a wheelchair to use and gave us helpful advise on how to negotiate the chair within the museum. 

The collection of the Boehm Porcelain collection was beautiful!

data.title: Great
data.text: Great historical items from Clarksville. Nice little area for children to learn some activities. Go there to beat the heat. It's affordable and a great way to learn about Clarksville history. Local artists are featured too. Check for special showings of different local attractions. Inexpensive for about half day.

data.title: Great place to take the kids
data.text: My daughter and her three cousins love going to the museum. There's so much for them to do. There's something for children of any age. If you've never been you got to take time to take your kids. I know they'll love it and have lots of fun.

data.title: A Must For Locals
data.text: Nicely done. The building is beautiful and one section is still untouched from when it was a bank. Handicapped accessible ramps and elevator. Must check out the Bubble room. Some really nice exhibits for the little ones.  If you have young children or grandkids buy the membership!

data.title: I love this place!!
data.text: I might be biased because I grew up going here but it is educational and fun for all ages. I will say it is more interesting if you read the descriptions, especially on the artwork. I like the trains best and the glass birds. Make sure to bring your cameras because some things are a little too amazing to be true. this museum takes about 1-2 hours if done right.

data.title: Eclectic Museum, worth at least one visit
data.text: Babysitting grandson and felt the need to get him out of the house and away from the video game for a couple hours. Weather was too nasty for outdoor activities, so we tried the museum. They have a variety of exhibits, including art, history of the area, history of the flag, a train set, and a children's hands on area (bubble cave, mock store, ball chutes, etc.). The train set only runs on Sunday and it was a Saturday, but they have some buttons to start some of the action parts of the set. The bubble cave is unique, though one or two of the exhibits were not working. The history of Clarksville was probably the highlight, though the grandson quickly lost interest in that (he's seven). The gift shop is equally eclectic, but didn't find anything to buy. If you can, go on the second Saturday of the month, when admission is free....

data.title: A lot of potential
data.text: I was impressed by the Clarksville history here.  Basement floor unfinished, train set is more of a hodge-podge of small toys and only runs for like 30 minutes a week.  Liked the existing exhibits, nice little play area for the kids.

data.title: Great place to take kid and educational.
data.text: Visiting my sister over Spring break we decided to check this place out with our kids. So happy we did we all had a lot of fun. Played with the bubbles for a while and just really enjoyed the quality time we got to spend together. Lots of educational things to see and learn about but is in the process of upgrading. Probably a good hour to an hour and a half of fun for the family. Also very decent prices on memberships.

data.title: Good Experience
data.text: This museum is a nice place to visit. The U.S. Flags exhibit was very interesting and informative. The museum also has a good presentation of the area's history and sports figures and even a "Bubble Room" for the kids. Unfortunately, that is all there is to see. (My wife, daughter, and I saw everything in just under an hour.) It's good for locals or area travelers who need a fill in as part of an overall itinerary which includes other local attractions.

data.title: Unlimited Potential
data.text: A lovely museum with unlimited potential for future development. I recently visited with my ten-year-old son and was surprised by the small yet attractive amount of items on display. All of the exhibits were readily available and the place was immaculate. Although, it is a small museum it was certainly worth our time and there are plenty of exhibits to keep you busy for a couple of hours. As an added bonus they have an exploration and discovery area just for kids in the basement. My son fell in love with the bubble makers and kids supermarket.

data.title: If you are a Clarksville native, this might be for you...
data.text:
My family drove to Clarksville to visit the Customs House Museum today. This was our second attempt to visit here. We made the 90 minute drive once before only to find they were closed (last year on Father's Day). "Customs House" is a rather misleading name. This museum is basically the history of the town of Clarksville, save for one gallery of U.S. flags (which was quite interesting...). A much more appropriate name for the museum would've been "Clarksville History Museum." 
The cost was reasonable --$17 for two adults and one child. The overall displays were very limited. We were finished in less than an hour. The lower floor with children's displays (trains and a grocery store ??) was closed for renovation. 
The architecture of the building itself is stunning, but we were quite disappointed with the museum itself. We will not be returning.

data.title: Family outing
data.text: Great place to take the family. I loved the painting gallery and the collection of historic American flags. Diverse attractions kept the whole family engaged. they were renovating the interactive area and train set for children. It will be that much better. Great place to take the family.

data.title: Very interesting history
data.text: Nice displays of the history of the Clarksville area.  Some art is exhibited as well as a display and play area for children.  A nice start if you are new to the area or visiting.
